dish_description: The dish is pork tenderloin steak, served with a garnish of corn and mushrooms. The pork is seasoned and pan-fried, then served with a sauce made from V8 juice and accompanied by a simple vegetable garnish.

cooking_steps.description: Remove the thick skin from the pork tenderloin using a knife, ensuring the meat remains lean.
Cut the pork tenderloin into four equal steaks, each weighing approximately 4 ounces.
Heat a tablespoon of butter and a dash of oil in a pan, then season the pork steaks with salt and pepper before cooking.
Cook the pork steaks in the pan for about 3 to 4 minutes on each side, partially covering the pan to prevent splattering.
Add chopped onions to the pan and cook them in the pork drippings.
Remove the pork steaks from the pan once they are cooked to the desired doneness, with a slight pinkness in the center.
Deglaze the pan with a quarter cup of V8 juice, adding it to the onions and drippings.
In the same pan, add a dash of oil, coarsely chopped mushrooms, and a tablespoon of water to loosen the mixture.
Add half a cup of frozen corn to the pan with the mushrooms and cook briefly.
Season the corn and mushroom mixture with salt, pepper, and 1 or 2 tablespoons of chives.
Serve the pork tenderloin steaks with the corn and mushroom garnish on a platter.
